basic_node.title: Refractive index of atmosphere
basic_node.description: Refractive index being the ratio of vacuum wavelength to wavelength in permeated matter, here atmosphere. Thus, being the ratio of speed of light in vacuum to speed of light in permeated matter, here atmosphere, and calculable by the square root of material/atmospheric dielectric permittivity multiplied by material/atmospheric magnetic permeability.
basic_node.references: [sp46, https://ieeexplore.ieee.org/document/9197138/] [sp47, http://link.springer.com/10.1007/978-3-642-10523-4, p.93] [sp48, https://ieeexplore.ieee.org/document/8500511/, Mutual influence of absorption; reflection and transmission: A + R + T = 1 with absorption coefficient A; reflection coefficient R; transmission coefficient T. Thus; causes for one of these three inevitably affect the other two.] [sp48, https://linkinghub.elsevier.com/retrieve/pii/S0924271612000378, Mutual influence of absorption; reflection and transmission: A + R + T = 1 with absorption coefficient A; reflection coefficient R; transmission coefficient T. Thus; causes for one of these three inevitably affect the other two.] [sp48, http://link.springer.com/10.1007/978-3-319-12352-3_18, p.415 Mutual influence of absorption; reflection and transmission: A + R + T = 1 with absorption coefficient A; reflection coefficient R; transmission coefficient T. Thus; causes for one of these three inevitably affect the other two.]
